document_title: Facial paralysis (VII nerve palsy, Bell's palsy) diagnosis and treatment
subsection_name: liet-mat.json_1_Causes and risk factors for facial paralysis
subsection_content:
The cause of facial paralysis has not yet been specifically determined, but vascular ischemia, autoimmune disease or viral infection, especially the latent herpes virus group (herpes simplex, herpes zoster) are considered to be the causes. popular cause.
Viruses associated with Bell's palsy include viruses that cause:
Herpes and genital herpes (herpes simplex); Chickenpox and shingles (herpes zoster); Infectious mononucleosis (Epstein-Barr); Cytomegalovirus infection; Respiratory disease (adenovirus); German measles (rubella); Mumps (mumps virus); Influenza (influenza B); Hand, foot and mouth disease (coxsackievirus)
In addition, genetics and tooth extraction are also considered risk factors for facial paralysis. In addition, there are other factors such as:
Diabetes; Bilateral Bell's palsy; Borreliosis; Mycoplasma pneumoniae infection; Guillain-Barre syndrome; Miller-Fisher syndrome; Sarcoidosis; Moebius syndrome; Leukemia; Fracture of skull base; Pontine gliomas; Leprosy; Mononucleosis; Pregnancy; Brainstem encephalitis; Hansen's disease; Cryptococcal meningitis; Pontine tegmental hemorrhage; Systemic lupus erythematosus; Spinal muscular atrophy
